name: MedGlobal
mission:
MedGlobal is a humanitarian charitable non-governmental organization that provides emergency response and health programs to build resilience among vulnerable communities around the world. Our health programs support victims of wars and disasters, refugees, internally displaced persons, and marginalized communities in disaster-affected and low-resource settings.

MedGlobal was launched in 2017 by a diverse group of doctors, nurses, global health specialists, and humanitarians to address the health needs of the most vulnerable populations. MedGlobal partners with local communities to address their health priorities, builds resilience through training and education and deploys healthcare volunteers, and donates medical equipment, medications and supplies.

MedGlobal field teams support local health programs for vulnerable populations in North and Latin America, Africa, MENA region, Europe, and Southeast Asia. Our growing field teams and partner organizations are supported by selfless volunteer nurses, and medical professionals of all specialties from 27 countries who embrace our mission.
programs: Lebanon- Development and Relief Services & Emergency Response
Palestinian Territories - Development and Relief Services
Sudan- Development and Relief Services & Emergency Response
theoryOfChange: By partnering with local leaders and health professionals to deliver urgent care while investing in sustainable, community-owned solutions, MedGlobal builds stronger healthcare systems that endure beyond immediate crises.

judge_issues.message: The impact rationale mentions the need for more granular evidence regarding cost-effectiveness per beneficiary, but it does not mention the missing board governance score (0/10) due to a board size of only 1 member. This is a significant factor contributing to the low impact score and should be included in the rationale.
Jargon detected in baseline narrative: 'asnaf categories'

risks.risk_summary: Key concern: Board too small: 1 members

score_details.score_summary: MedGlobal, Inc. shows strong alignment and moderate impact, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://medglobal.org/zakat (Source: https://medglobal.org/zakat)

all_citations.claim: MedGlobal offers various donation options and giving methods for its humanitarian programs.
MedGlobal holds a 98.33333333333333/100 score and reports a program expense ratio of 85.9% and fundraising efficiency of $0.13 per $1 raised.
The organization reported total revenue of $12,632,992 and holds 3.4 months of working capital.
MedGlobal is Zakat-eligible and maintains a specific policy regarding asnaf categories.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: MedGlobal earns a moderate overall score due to its exceptional financial transparency and strong alignment with humanitarian needs, though its impact score is tempered by the direct nature of its provision and lack of specific cost-per-beneficiary data.
areas_for_improvement: Limited working capital of 3.4 months, which may impact long-term financial resilience during funding fluctuations
Opportunity to improve impact measurement transparency to raise the current impact score

dimension_explanations.alignment: MedGlobal shows high alignment for Muslim donors as a Zakat-eligible organization that addresses urgent global health crises [4]. Its mission to serve refugees and those in emergency zones like Syria and Pakistan resonates with high-priority humanitarian causes [1][2].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization focuses on the direct provision of medical services in high-conflict and disaster-prone areas [2]. While it demonstrates strong financial health with a total revenue of $12,632,992 and an 85.9% program expense ratio, the impact score of 22/50 reflects a need for more granular evidence regarding cost-effectiveness per beneficiary [2][3].

baseline_narrative.headline: MedGlobal, Inc. provides critical medical relief and sustainable healthcare services to vulnerable populations and refugees in crisis zones worldwide.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 85.9%, ensuring the majority of funds reach those in need
Strong fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.13 per $1 raised
Verified Zakat-eligible status with a dedicated policy for asnaf categories
baseline_narrative.summary: MedGlobal, Inc. is a humanitarian organization that partners with local entities to deliver health services in the Kutupalong refugee camp in Bangladesh, as well as development and relief services in Syria and emergency response in Pakistan [2][3]. The organization maintains a high level of financial accountability, evidenced by a Charity Navigator score of 98.33333333333333/100 [2].

alignment.explanation: MedGlobal is a strong fit for Muslim donors, offering <cite id="9">verified Zakat eligibility</cite> and serving <cite id="3">Muslim-majority regions in crisis</cite>.
alignment.improvement: The charity could further improve alignment by <cite id="16">expanding services to more underserved geographies</cite> with limited nonprofit coverage.

credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the organization should <cite id="13">expand its board of directors</cite> to ensure more robust independent oversight.

rich_narrative.headline: MedGlobal, Inc. provides critical medical relief and sustainable healthcare services to vulnerable populations and refugees in crisis zones worldwide.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who prioritize immediate medical relief in high-conflict zones and want to maximize the percentage of their Zakat reaching the field.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill Zakat obligations through medical aid
Value high financial efficiency and low fundraising overhead
Care about medical infrastructure in Gaza and Syria
Prefer organizations with high third-party transparency ratings
giving_considerations: The 85.9% program ratio is exceptional but requires consistent monitoring
Governance is currently centralized with a small board
Impact is measured internally rather than through external academic studies
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking long-term advocacy or those who require rigorous external RCT evaluations of impact.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects that the organization tracks <cite id="12">five outcome metrics</cite> and has a clear theory of change, but lacks independent external evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: MedGlobal aims to eliminate health barriers by providing immediate acute care that transitions into comprehensive healthcare system strengthening.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that medical interventions actually lead to improved health outcomes in refugee settings.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: The high demand for medical services in Gaza and Sudan exceeds current revenue levels.

strengths.detail: The organization maintains a <cite id="5">85.9% program expense ratio</cite>, ensuring that all reported contributions are directed toward its medical missions.
MedGlobal has earned a <cite id="8">98.33333333333333/100 overall score</cite> from Charity Navigator and holds a Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid.
The charity provides a <cite id="4">dedicated Zakat policy</cite> and serves high-urgency regions including Gaza and Syria.

strengths_deep_dive: MedGlobal's operational strength lies in its ability to maintain <cite id="10">3.4 months of working capital</cite>, providing significant resilience for its international medical missions. This financial stability is paired with <cite id="11">85.9% independent board members</cite>, ensuring that governance remains objective and focused on the mission of reducing health barriers in crisis areas. Their impact is further validated by <cite id="12">tracking five distinct outcome metrics</cite> through Candid, demonstrating a commitment to measuring actual health improvements rather than just output volume.
rich_narrative.summary: founded in 2017, MedGlobal, Inc. is a humanitarian organization dedicated to providing <cite id="1">critical medical relief and sustainable healthcare services</cite> to vulnerable populations and refugees in crisis zones worldwide. The organization operates through a model of <cite id="2">direct provision of health services</cite>, notably within the Kutupalong refugee camp in Bangladesh, while also maintaining significant operations in <cite id="3">Gaza, Sudan, Ukraine, and Syria</cite>. MedGlobal distinguishes itself through a commitment to financial transparency and efficiency, reporting <cite id="4">total revenue of $12,632,992</cite> in its most recent filings. The organization demonstrates exceptional fiscal responsibility, maintaining a <cite id="5">85.9% program expense ratio</cite> and a highly efficient fundraising model that costs only <cite id="6">$0.13 per $1 raised</cite>. Beyond emergency response, MedGlobal invests in long-term health infrastructure through <cite id="7">medical training and healthcare system strengthening</cite>. The charity holds a <cite id="8">98.33333333333333/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting its robust accountability and leadership standards. For Muslim donors, MedGlobal offers a <cite id="9">verified Zakat-eligible giving platform</cite> that directs funds toward specific asnaf categories, including the poor (fuqara) and needy (masakin).
